WorkItem.Description:
I believe F#'s event support requires events be of type EventHandler<T> with the event args derived from EventArgs.
 
compiler error:
VertexService.fs(183,9): error FS0191: The event 'EdgeAdded has a non-standard type. If this event is declared in another .NET language, you may need to access this event using the explicit add_EdgeAdded and remove_EdgeAdded methods for the event. If this event is declared in F#, make the type of the event an instantiation of either 'IDelegateEvent<_>' or 'IEvent<_,_>'
 
here is a repro case from vs2008 with the current f# ctp, though it should also fail in vs2010:
 
let x = QuickGraph.BidirectionalGraph()
x.EdgeAdded |> Event.listen (fun _ -> ()) // error
x.add_EdgeAdded(fun _ -> ()) // works
WorkItem.Summary: Edge & Vertex events have a non-standard type, F# compiler complains

Comments.Message: Have you raised the issue to the F# team? This is the most stupid limitation i've ever heard of.
QuickGraph used to use EventArgs but I moved to my own classes a while ago. Where are IDelegateEvent/IEvent defined?

IDelegateEvent/IEvent are F# specific so it doesn't affect QuickGraph. I agree it's pretty dumb but I'm not sure if they're going to fix it for VS 2010... mostly due to generic constraints put on the F# Event library. I've attached a simple repro case that shows it being fixed by using EventHandler<T> & EventArgs.
